column4: i am running ubuntu haardy on my thinkpad r52 and everytime I play a flash movie my laptop overheats and shuts down. Can some one help?
Yes I do - lms-ensors is the latest version.
have you checked the fans in the laptop? they may need to be replaced.
Yes - my fans are fine I opened and checked. Also cat /proc/acpi/ibm/fan shows the speed and is set to auto
is there a way to increase or keep constant the speed of the fan?
There are a set of registers I can "tee" with specific values to control fan speed. But I would rather not. Is there aany other solution?
Why does flash stress my tp so much?
how do I change the dynamic cpu scaling to "ondemand"? Thanks
read the doc. I get a "permission denied" when I try to echo "ondemand" into scaling_governor. Yes I have setbit on cpufreq as the doc suggested. What could be wrong?
yeah, that should do it... check the permissions of the file and the directories it's in
